AltText: Matthiola maderensis perched on a clifftop on the Ponta de Sāo Lourenço
Title: Matthiola maderensis
CaptionAbstract: Matthiola maderensis in Madeira. It is one of an incredibly high number of plants endemic to Madeira which, like other islands in the Madeiran archipelago, has a very high rate of endemism. 10% of species found there are endemic, making it an exciting place for a plant lover like me. This is due to the island having being isolated from the mainland ever since it's explosive birth 5 million years ago.
